entry.title: TextMate 2.0
entry.content: After using the [TextEdit] (default editor) for editing, I quickly realized that this probably was not the best lightweight editor for development purposes on the Mac, and I was looking for what would be the Mac equivallent of the Windows version of [Notepadd++]. After some searching and trying a handful of editors I did manage to come across TextMate. Although it was not a free text editor, it functioned in all ways that I would have that expected a good coding editor would: great comfort, highly configurable and fast. For now TextMate remains my favourite editor of choice even though there is another ‘just-as-good’ editor on the block called [Sublime Text] that supposedly surpasses TextMate and which also costs money for a license. When it all comes down to it, its all just a matter of personal preference and for some that may even be a non-GUI editor such as [Vim, Emacs, Nanoâ€¦etc]. However it wasn’t until recently and with much excitement for the creators of This is great news for you and for me, because this means that anyone can go here and using [git], <clone> a copy onto their local computer and “get-your-build-on” to get the compiled working application of TextMate 2.0 on your system for free. Also if you are a developer and feel that you can make a contribution to this already nice piece of software, you may also use [git] to <fork> a copy for development purposes.

entry.title: Welcome to Skull0Inc
entry.content:
This is my (Skull0Inc) introductory post for testing the use of the [octopress] blogging framework which was used to to generate these website pages and along with the hosting of the site which is being done by [github].

For some time now I have always wanted to have a website just for the sake of being part of what the internet is -which is a collection of human shared ideas- as we collectively assimilate our disparate thoughts into harnessing the also ever growing collective power of the internet. Now it is more of a means of necessity that I think I should have a website. For me, it is going to be a personal documentation area, where I can just jot down any procedures or things that I come across ever-so-often so that they may be like little reminders of things that I think are noteworthy. Also for you, hopefully it will be a resource of little reminders . In addition to that, its just a fun creative outlet for me to do something somewhat technical and enjoy the use of technology as it is in today’s format. Yes, that’s it. Its a celebration of the internet by using that very said collective resource and adding to it.
